abstract: As more Web-enabled services make their way into passenger vehicles, our colleagues at Bits foresee an explosion of business models crafted around the wired driver.
snippet: As more Web-enabled services make their way into passenger vehicles, our colleagues at Bits foresee an explosion of business models crafted around the wired driver.
lead_paragraph: Our colleagues at Bits report from CTIA, a wireless industry gathering in San Diego, where companies are eager to highlight how passenger cars are the next frontier for wired services. "Five percent of cars are connected today," said Glenn Lurie, president of AT&T's Emerging Devices business. He was speaking of new vehicles, not all cars on the road. "Three to five years from now, 100 percent will be connected." Read more »

headline.main: The Next Boom in Mobile Technology Happens in the Car
